p: Animal viruses are also important causes of zoonosis. The recent zoonotic episodes of Nipah virus, Hendra virus [ 50], and, more importantly, avian influenza [ 51– 53], are a growing list of examples on infectious agents that can pass from animals to humans without previous “warning”, a particularly worrisome scenario given that 75% of human infections are estimated to be zoonotic in origin [ 54].
